item.title: Creating & Deploying a Personal Site in One Flight
item.description: I usually read on flights. A flight is the best excuse to disconnect and spend time on a book I’ve been putting off. With no distractions. And with ginger ale. But on the night before a recent cross-country flight from Oakland to Baltimore I decided I wanted to finally create a personal site. I had heard of static site generator tools like Jeckyl and Hugo before, but had never tried them.

item.title: About
item.description: David Scrobonia is a Security Engineer at Segment working to secure modern web apps and AWS infrastructure. He graduated from Cal Poly SLO with a BS/MS in Computer Engineering/Computer Science where he contributed to the AppSensor project for his thesis. David contributes to open source in his spare time and is a core team member of the OWASP ZAP project where he helped develop the Heads Up Display.
